why does cropping reduces the accuracy if the cropping is done to remove black background?

we have a 100% accuracy now? isn't that to good to be true?

I tend to say skip this for now. We can fix this after the tutorial

it's a detail for the tutorial and it would raise too many questions in the audience

title: title

text:
In plot_haxby_decoding.py, numpy.in1d is called. This function has been added to numpy 1.4.0 but numpy >= 1.3.0 is required for the scikit-learn. Should we require numpy 1.4.0 ?

Related numpy man page : http://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy/reference/generated/numpy.in1d.html

``` python
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "plot_haxby_decoding.py", line 44, in <module>
    condition_mask = np.in1d(conditions, ('face', 'house'))
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'in1d'
```
title: Numpy 1.4 required

text:
> In plot_haxby_decoding.py, numpy.in1d is called. This function has been added to numpy 1.4.0 but numpy >= 1.3.0 is required for the scikit-learn.

Good catch!

> Should we require numpy 1.4.0 ?

No. We need to find a workaroud, for instance using np.logical_or on the
two conditions.

Can you take care of this?

> I'll take a look after lunch time.

OK, I'll probably be off-line till late tonight by then.

Also, I don't understand how this commit fixes my problem: from the debug that I did, it seemed that the problem was an error in the download URL. I am testing the fix, but as the download takes a while, I am not sure that my fix is correct.

Before I scrap my work by pulling from your branch, I'd like to be really sure that it fixes the problem.

On top of this, the fact that you committed in your master branch will make history management a bit convoluted.
title: (None, None, None)

text:
Your problem with kamitani was a URL problem but with NYU the problem was that you had an incomplete download archive. My fix, when trying to uncompress a dataset, will download again an archive if it is corrupted.

Sorry for messing up with git but I am not very familiar with several people working on several branches. Do you want me to move the commit to another branch ?

text:
In _plot_haxby_decoding_, some assertions are given about Haxby dataset shape in comments :

``` python
# fmri_data.shape is (40, 64, 64, 1452)
# and mask.shape is (40, 64, 64)
```

These assertions are now untrue because Haxby dataset has been cropped.

``` python
In [16]: fmri_data.shape
Out[16]: (40, 49, 41, 1452)
```

We should propagate these modifications and make it a doctest or a real assertion to avoid further problems.
title: Haxby cropped : propagate modifications

text: go for it!
I am not sure this is still necessary as the slice has been changed in the example. @AlexandreAbraham can you take a look?

title: Searchlight

text:
works fine for me now.

> How about having no colorbar?

why not...

how about hacking the gen_rst to avoid call to tight_layout?

> It actually breaks some other layouts, which then need figure size
> tuning.
> 
> It's a tradeoff. If you think that we can do without colorbar, I'd prefer
> that option.

ok fair enough.  Let's keep it as simple as possible

> @GaelVaroquaux : as computation takes only 70s, is it OK to do it on the entire slice or should we shrink it to keep only the back of the brain or 1 voxel out of 2 like suggested ?

It's OK like this. Good job!

G

This branch fails for me (did you test it using the building process, Alex A?): 
$ make doc
...
plotting plot_haxby_searchlight.py
________________________________________________________________________________
plot_haxby_searchlight.py is not compiling:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/varoquau/dev/nisl/tutorial/doc/sphinxext/gen_rst.py", line
304, in generate_file_rst
    execfile(os.path.basename(src_file), my_globals)
  File "plot_haxby_searchlight.py", line 60, in 
    scores = searchlight.fit(X, y)
  File "/home/varoquau/dev/nisl/tutorial/nisl/searchlight.py", line 239,
in fit
    self.score_func, self.cv, self.n_jobs, self.verbose)
  File "/home/varoquau/dev/nisl/tutorial/nisl/searchlight.py", line 81,
in search_light
    for list_i in group_iter)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/joblib/parallel.py", line 451, in
__call__
    self._pool = multiprocessing.Pool(n_jobs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/__init__.py", line 232, in
Pool
    return Pool(processes, initializer, initargs, maxtasksperchild)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 136, in
__init__
    self._repopulate_pool()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 199, in
_repopulate_pool
    w.start()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 130, in
start
    self._popen = Popen(self)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/forking.py", line 116, in
__init__
    sys.stdout.flush()
AttributeError: 'Tee' object has no attribute 'flush'
________________________________________________________________________________
This is a bug in gen_rst.py that I will fix. That said, it reveals that you are using n_jobs != 1, which we should never do by default. Could you fix that please. G

On Tue, Jun 26, 2012 at 03:59:31PM +0200, Gael Varoquaux wrote:

> This is a bug in gen_rst.py that I will fix. That said, it reveals that
> you are using n_jobs != 1, which we should never do by default. Could you
> fix that please.

Forget it, I am fixing it.

On Tue, Jun 26, 2012 at 04:00:23PM +0200, Gael Varoquaux wrote:

> Forget it, I am fixing it.

Fixed. Can you pull from my searchlight branch

Could you please make verbose be an integer that controls the amount of
verbosity: for instance, between 1 and 10 it could control the frequency
of message: 10 = all iterations print, 1 = one iteration out of 10. Right
now the code is too verbose.

Also, please add an estimation of remaining time. People are impatient.

Finally, in the verbosity message: "1 on 3008" -> "1 / 3008"/

Your example is missing a docstring and a title (it does not show up
right in the example page).

Also, when I run 'make plot', the resulting image is garbbled (colormaps
screwed).

PS: it takes 251s on my box. That's a bit slow. We'll worry about this
later.

The generated example page does not look right (the two figures are not
plotted). Please fix that.

> Yes, I am working on the visualization/documentation right now.

Cool. Thanks. Can you also add the figure of searchligh to the front
page, as the others are (beware, there is some javascript magic).

I am not sure that the 'use_gridspec' is an option: it is too recent, and thus we'll have it fail on some attendee's computer.

How about having no colorbar?

> how about hacking the gen_rst to avoid call to tight_layout?

It actually breaks some other layouts, which then need figure size
tuning.

It's a tradeoff. If you think that we can do without colorbar, I'd prefer
that option.

G
This has been merged
no s at data

@GaelVaroquaux : pyplot and not pylab as pl ?

On Tue, Jun 26, 2012 at 10:48 AM, Alexandre Abraham
reply@reply.github.com
wrote:

> > +# Make processing parallel
> > +# /!\ As each thread will print its progress, this could mess up a little
> > +#     information output.
> > +n_jobs = 2
> > +
> > +score_func = f1_score
> > +
> > +# A cross validation method is needed to measure precision of each voxel
> > +cv = KFold(y.size, k=4)
> > +searchlight = searchlight.SearchLight(mask, process_mask, radius=1.5,
> > -        n_jobs=n_jobs, score_func=score_func, verbose=True, cv=cv)
> >   +# scores.scores is an array containing per voxel precision
> >   +scores = searchlight.fit(X, y)
> >   +
> >   +### Unmask the data and display it
> >   +pyplot.imshow(np.rot90(scores.scores[..., 26]), interpolation='nearest',
> 
> Gaël asked me to use pyplot explicitely and avoid aliases as much as possible (except for numpy -> np)
>

text: First implementation of searchlight
Got example script running with small, possibly wrong changes
Merge searchlight

Make searchlight work :
- cross validation is no more LeaveOnOut on 2 elements
- result of cross validation is meaned

Remove not working starplus example.
Add haxby example (for the moment, computing is very long)
Some simple docstring updates mostly
LinearSVC as default extimator

Jaques patch #2
*fit* must only have data/labels as parameters
Move other parameters over into __init__

Clean up searchlight

Speed it up be using smaller region of the brain
Searchlight visualisation on one slice only (speeds up computing)

Fix documentation (in the lib and the script)
Change the script in order to compute directly the adjacency matrix
with the scikit learn instead of  doing it by hand.
Make searchlight take the mask as a parameter

Searchlight now takes two masks in input :
- mask : the anatomical mask
- process_mask : voxels to be processed
Rotate the brain, use F1_score instead of precision.

Take Alex's suggestions into account
- typos
- indentation/formatting problems
- code simplification
- script now shows a map of F_scores
Fixing multiprocessing

Restrain computation, add documentation

This is still a work in progress and is only run on Windows
Comments added to plot_haxby_searchlight
Restrain computation to the back of the brain
F_score computation is commented out because generates an error on
Windows :

C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\sklearn\feature_selection\univariate_selection.py:92:

f = msb / msw

C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\colors.py:533: RuntimeWarning:
invalid value encountered in less
cbook._putmask(xa, xa<0.0, -1)
Verbosity is now an integer.

Change colorbar and add documentation page.
Change colorbar to gnuplot2
Lighten Searchlight page. Add code snippet and figures.

Remove colorbars for Searchlight
Change F_score colormap for something more salient, threshold the values
Add searchlight picture to index random figures.
